enchantment.ars_nouveau.mana_regen.desc: Increases the mana regeneration of the player.
enchantment.ars_nouveau.mana_boost.desc: Increases the maximum mana of the player.
enchantment.ars_nouveau.reactive.desc: Has a chance to cast the inscribed spell on tool use or player hurt.
ars_nouveau.page.jar_of_light: Summons a light that will follow the user as they move. Can be summoned and dismissed at any time.
ars_nouveau.page.amulet_of_mana_boost: Increases max mana by a moderate amount.
ars_nouveau.page.amulet_of_mana_regen: Increases mana regeneration by a moderate amount.
ars_nouveau.page.arcane_relay: Enables the transport of source between Source Jars and other Source Relays. To pull source from jars, use the Dominion Wand on the jar, and then on the relay. To send between relays or from a relay to a jar, use the wand on the relay and then the target you wish to send source to. Relays may only reach up to 30 blocks away. To clear connections, sneak while using the Dominion Wand on the relay.
ars_nouveau.page.arcane_relay_splitter: Operates similar to the Source Relay, but will support taking from and transferring to multiple jars at once. The splitter has a much larger through-put than the Source Relay, and will split this throughput amongst all of its jars. See the instructions on the Source Relay for use.
ars_nouveau.page.enchanting_apparatus1: The Enchanting Apparatus utilizes pedestals and Source for crafting. To use the Enchanting Apparatus, place any number of Arcane Pedestals nearby with their items. Once you have filled the pedestals, use the middle item on the Enchanting Apparatus block. The Enchanting Apparatus requires an Arcane Core beneath it in order to work.
ars_nouveau.page.mana_bloom_crop: A magically infused flower, Mageblooms provide additional source to nearby Agronomic Sourcelinks as they grow and provide a source of Magebloom Fiber. Mageblooms can also be used in crafting Potions of Spell Damage, increasing the damage of your spells.
ars_nouveau.page.belt_of_levitation: A belt that allows the user levitate a moderate distance above the ground. Useful for climbing mountains! Simply sneak in the air while falling (or jumping) to rise.
ars_nouveau.page.ring_of_lesser_discount: In addition to providing a small bonus to maximum mana and mana regen, Rings of Discount reduce the total cost to cast a spell.
ars_nouveau.page.ring_of_greater_discoun: Provides a slightly larger discount over the Lesser Ring of Discount.
ars_nouveau.page.belt_of_unstable_gifts: Occasionally grants a random positive potion effect for a short duration. These effects can vary in strength.
ars_nouveau.page.whelp_charm: Bookwyrms are helpful creatures with the ability to cast spells using source from source jars. Given a spell inscribed on Spell Parchment, Bookwyrms will cast spells in the area surrounding their Lectern. To summon a Bookwyrm, use a Bookwyrm Charm on a Lectern. Bookwyrms can be dyed using white, black, blue, green, red, or purple dye.
ars_nouveau.page2.whelp_charm: In the event that they die or are dispelled, they will drop their charm.
ars_nouveau.page3.whelp_charm: Bookwyrms can cast spells that begin with Touch or Projectile. You may give them a spell that is written on Spell Parchment. Currently, Bookwyrms will only target blocks surrounding their crystal. Spell casting will consume source from jars that are within 7 blocks of their Lectern. By default, Bookwyrms will only cast a spell if EVERY spell effect will do something. Harvest will only be cast on trees or fully grown crops, or Grow on crops that are not full grown.
ars_nouveau.page4.whelp_charm: To disable this strict mode, use a Dominion Wand, however using multiple specialized Bookwyrms is recommended. While Bookwyrms cannot pickup blocks on their own, they may store items in chests that are next to the Summoning Crystal using the Item Pickup spell. Conversely, Bookwyrms may place blocks and interact with the world using Items. You may give an item or block to the Bookwyrm, and it will use the item directly from the chests adjacent to the lectern.
ars_nouveau.page5.whelp_charm: The range of the Bookwyrm can be extended by using a Dominion Wand on the lectern while sneaking.
ars_nouveau.page.carbuncle_charm: Carbuncles naturally appear in wooded areas in search of golden nuggets. While carbuncles are normally afraid of humans, they will allow someone to approach if they are holding a gold nugget. When a carbuncle has picked up a golden nugget, it will vanish from this world and leave behind Carbuncle Shards.
ars_nouveau.page2.carbuncle_charm: While wild carbuncles cannot be tamed, their shards may be used to summon a carbuncle.
ars_nouveau.page3.carbuncle_charm: To summon a carbuncle, use a carbuncle charm on the ground. Summoned carbuncles will pickup nearby items and can move items between inventories such as chests. Carbuncles will harvest fully grown Source Berry bushes around it. A Carbuncle will drop its charm when Dispelled or when killed. You may dye them using purple, red, yellow, orange, blue, or green dye.
ars_nouveau.page4.carbuncle_charm: To bind a carbuncle to place items into a chest, use the dominion wand on the carbuncle and then the inventory. To take items from an inventory, use the wand on the inventory and then the Carbuncle. Carbuncles will move items between as many inventories as you desire. Looking at a Carbuncle will tell you how many chests are being taken from, and input to. Using the Dominion Wand on a Carbuncle while sneaking will reset them.
ars_nouveau.page5.carbuncle_charm: You may dictate where items go and may be picked up by using Item Scrolls or Item Frames. A Carbuncle may be given an Item Scroll: Allow or Deny, and will only pickup and move items respecting that filter. Alternatively, you may place an Item Frame on the inventory a carbuncle is interacting with. You may either place an Item Scroll or a single item directly on the frame. Carbuncles interacting with that inventory will respect item framed filters.
ars_nouveau.page.summoning_crystal: Summoning Crystals provide source, resources, and tasks to special magical creatures, like Sylphs! Placing a chest next to a Summoning Crystal will provide a place for summoned creatures to store their items.
ars_nouveau.page2.summoning_crystal: Creatures like Sylphs will require source to interact with the world. Place a Source Jar within the vicinity and begin providing it with source. To begin your first automation, see the entry on the Sylph Charm.
ars_nouveau.page.reactive: Reactive is an enchantment that can be applied to ANY item and can be applied and upgraded by the Enchanting Apparatus. Tools and armor with the Reactive enchantment have a chance to automatically cast a spell on use or when the player is hurt. The spell that the enchantment will cast is dependent on the spell inscribed in the first crafting phase, and the user must have enough mana to cast the spell.
ars_nouveau.page.reactive2: To enchant an item with Reactive, place any item or armor in the apparatus. The spell parchment placed on the pedestal must be inscribed with a valid spell. See the Scribes Table for additional information. Reactive Enchantment also requires jars of source near the Enchanting Apparatus. The first level enchantment requires approximately one third of a jar.
ars_nouveau.page.reactive3: To upgrade the enchantment, replace the reagent with any item that has an existing Reactive enchantment. The Tier 2 reactive enchantment requires an item with Reactive I, and the Tier 3 Reactive enchantment requires an item with Reactive II. Higher levels will require a significantly higher amount of source nearby.
ars_nouveau.page.reactive4: The spell that Reactive gear casts can be changed by placing an enchanted piece of gear into the apparatus with a new inscribed spell parchment.
alert.core: An Arcane Core must be placed beneath this block.
sylph.unhappy: The sylph seems very unhappy in her home. Try sprucing it up!
sylph.content: The sylph seems content, but could be better.
sylph.extremely_happy: The sylph is extremely happy! It doesn't seem like it wants anything else.
sylph.okay_diversity: There does not appear to be much diversity.
sylph.diverse_enough: There is some diversity, but could be better.
sylph.very_diverse: The sylph thinks her home is very diverse.
sylph.extremely_diverse: The home is extremely diverse, but sylphs will never turn down a new addition to their home!
sylph.notinterested: The sylph does not seem interested in this item.
sylph.excited: The sylph would be excited to have this in their home!
sylph.toomuch: The sylph likes this item, but has enough of it already.
ars_nouveau.page.sylph_charm: Sylphs are curious nature sprites that are exclusively found in forested areas. Summoned Sylphs can be given a home in the world, and will begin producing natural materials including wood, crops, seeds, and flowers that exist around them. Wild Sylphs can be befriended and will drop Sylph Shards if a tree is grown near them.
ars_nouveau.page2.sylph_charm: Sylphs will follow animals, players, and monsters! They will also grow grass around them every once and a while.
ars_nouveau.page3.sylph_charm: To summon a Sylph, use a Sylph charm on a Summoning Crystal. Sylphs consider their home to be 10 blocks in any direction from the Summoning Crystal. Sylphs require source nearby to operate, and will only generate items if there is a chest placed next to the Summoning Crystal. You can get your charm back by using Dispel on a sylph. They may be given orange, yellow, white, or green dye.
ars_nouveau.page4.sylph_charm: Summoned Sylphs must be happy in order to produce materials, and their mood is determined by the number and diversity of natural materials in their home. You may use blocks on the Sylph to gain additional info if a Sylph would enjoy that block in their home. Interacting with the sylph with an empty hand will give you additional info on the Sylphs happiness.
ars_nouveau.page5.sylph_charm: Note: It can take several minutes for a sylph to update its mood after placing a block. Sylphs value diversity, and too much of one block will no longer count.
ars_nouveau.page6.sylph_charm: Drop rates are determined by happiness, diversity, and the proportions of blocks in a Sylph home. For example, to generate a lot of logs, grow more trees. To gain more seeds and crop harvests, plant more crops. Giving a Sylph Item Scroll:Deny will cause the sylph will no longer produce that material.
ars_nouveau.page.crystallizer1: The crystallizer provides a renewable source of Source Gems by condensing source over time. The Crystallizer can work passively at a very slow rate, or it may be given source from adjacent jars and create Source Gems as a much faster rate. The Crystallizer may also be accessed by Hoppers and Carbuncles.
ars_nouveau.alert.turret_type: Turrets can only use Touch or Projectile.
ars_nouveau.alert.duplicate_method: No duplicate cast methods are allowed.
ars_nouveau.rune.touch: Runes must have Touch as their first glyph.
ars_nouveau.rune.error: Rune threw an error. Please report this! Bye rune!
ars_nouveau.allow_set: Carbuncle will only take these items.
ars_nouveau.spell.disabled: This spell has been disabled in the config.
ars_nouveau.page.void_jar: A jar that can destroy items on pickup and grants a small amount of mana in return. To turn the jar on and off, use the jar while sneaking. To add or remove an item to be destroyed by the jar, use the jar with an item in the off hand, or use an item on the Scribes Table with the jar placed on it. The jar must be in your hotbar to function.
ars_nouveau.page.runic_chalk: Runic chalk can be used to place permanent Runes on the ground that will cast spells on entities that walk over them. To give a rune a spell, inscribe spell parchment using the scribes table. Once the rune has cast the spell, it will become uncharged. An uncharged rune will charge itself from nearby source jars. Using Runic Chalk on a temporary rune will convert it to a permanent one.
ars_nouveau.wand.invalid: Invalid spell. Wands accept Effects and Augments only.
ars_nouveau.wixie.has_wixie: This cauldron already has a wixie.
tooltip.wixie_shard: Obtained by using Dispel on a witch while it is less than half health.
tooltip.carbuncle_shard: Obtained by giving a wild Carbuncle a Gold Nugget.
tooltip.sylph_shard: Obtained by growing a tree near a wild Sylph.
ars_nouveau.page.wixie_charm: A Wixie can automatically craft items for you at the expense of source. To obtain a Wixie Shard, cast Dispel on a Witch while it is half health or less. Once you have obtained a Wixie Charm, use it on a Cauldron to summon your Wixie.
ars_nouveau.page2.wixie_charm: To select an item for crafting, use your item or block on the Wixie Cauldron.
ars_nouveau.page3.wixie_charm: The Wixie will automatically select the recipe for crafting based on the inventories nearby, you need not specify the exact materials for the recipe. For example, if you want to craft Sticks, the Wixie will mix and match planks from nearby chests in order to fulfill the recipe. Each craft requires a small amount of source and will be automatically drained from nearby Source Jars. A redstone signal on the cauldron will stop crafting.
ars_nouveau.page.wand: Wands accept only a single spell, and are inscribed using the Scribes Table. A Wand always starts with Projectile -> Accelerate, and MUST be inscribed with a spell that does not have another method. This allows you to cast spells beyond the 10 spell cap. If you want a wand that casts Break, inscribe the wand with JUST break, and your result will be a wand with Projectile -> Acclerate -> Break.
ars_nouveau.page.spell_bow: A bow that can be inscribed with a spell using the Scribes Table. If the player has enough mana, arrows will become Spell Arrows and will apply the spell on their target. If no arrows are in the inventory, a spell arrow that deals 0 damage will be cast. If there is not enough mana, regular arrows will be fired. Enchanter's Bows may use special Augment Arrows for empowering the inscribed spell.
ars_nouveau.page.amplify_arrow: Adds two amplifies to the end of the inscribed spell when used. Each recipe makes 32.
ars_nouveau.page.pierce_arrow: Adds two pierce to the beginning of the chain. Each recipe makes 32.
ars_nouveau.page.split_arrow: Adds two split to the beginning of the chain. If a spell arrow will deal damage, each split arrow will as well. Each recipe makes 32.
ars_nouveau.bow.invalid: Bows may only accept spells that do not contain a form.
tooltip.wilden_spike: Drops from Wilden Defenders, found in cold biomes.
ars_nouveau.familiar_desc.bookwyrm: A Bookwyrm will reduce the cost of all spells cast, and increases any spell damage by 1. Obtained by performing the Ritual of Binding near a Bookwyrm.
ars_nouveau.familiar_desc.carbuncle: A Carbuncle familiar that will grant you Speed 2. Additionally, using a Golden Nugget on the carbuncle will consume it and grant the owner a short duration of Scrying for Gold Ore. Obtained by performing the Ritual of Binding near a Carbuncle.
ars_nouveau.familiar_desc.drygmy: A Drygmy familiar will increase the damage of Earth spells by 2, and has a chance to increase the amount of looting when slaying enemies. Obtained by performing the Ritual of Binding near a Drygmy.
ars_nouveau.familiar_desc.sylph: Sylphs will reduce the cost of Elemental Earth glyphs by half, and grants bonus saturation when consuming food. Obtained by performing the Ritual of Binding near a Sylph.
ars_nouveau.familiar_desc.wixie: Wixies will increases the duration of potions that you consume. Additionally, the Wixie will apply harmful potions to enemies during combat. Obtained by performing the Ritual of Binding near a Wixie.
ars_nouveau.glyph_desc.accelerate: Increases the speed of projectile spells.
ars_nouveau.glyph_desc.amplify: Additively increases the power of most spell effects. Can increase the harvest level of Break and increases the damage of spells.
ars_nouveau.glyph_desc.aoe: Spells will affect a larger area around a targeted block.
ars_nouveau.glyph_desc.blink: Teleports the caster to a location. If an entity is hit and the caster is holding a Warp Scroll in the offhand, the entity will be warped to the location on the Warp Scroll. When used on Self, the caster blinks forward. Spell Turrets and Runes can warp entities using Warp Scrolls from adjacent inventories without consuming the scroll.
ars_nouveau.glyph_desc.bounce: Gives players the Bounce effect, causing them to bounce upwards upon falling. Amplification of Bounce will preserve additional forward facing motion per bounce.
ars_nouveau.glyph_desc.break: A spell you start with. Breaks blocks of an average hardness. Can be amplified to increase the harvest level.
ars_nouveau.glyph_desc.cold_snap: Snares and causes a burst of damage to an entity that is afflicted by Slowness or is wet. Nearby enemies that are not afflicted by Slow will be slowed. Nearby Enemies afflicted by Slow or wetness will also be hit by Cold Snap. Can be augmented using Amplify, Extend Time, and AOE.
ars_nouveau.glyph_desc.conjure_water: Places water at a location or extinguishes entities on fire.
ars_nouveau.glyph_desc.crush: Turns stone into gravel, and gravel into sand. Will also harm entities and deals bonus damage to entities that are swimming.
ars_nouveau.glyph_desc.cut: Shears entities and blocks, or damages non-shearable entities for a small amount. Costs nothing.
ars_nouveau.glyph_desc.dampen: Decreases the power of most spells. Decreases the mana cost slighty, but never below 0.
ars_nouveau.glyph_desc.delay: Delays the resolution of effects placed to the right of this spell for a few moments. The delay may be increased with the Extend Time augment, or decreased with Duration Down.
ars_nouveau.glyph_desc.dispel: Removes any potion effects on the target. When used on a witch at half health, the witch will vanish in return for a Wixie shard. Will also dispel tamed Whelps, Carbuncles, and Sylphs back into their charm.
ars_nouveau.glyph_desc.duration_down: Reduces the duration of spells like potion effects, delay, redstone signal, and others.
ars_nouveau.glyph_desc.ender_inventory: Opens your personal ender chest inventory from anywhere.
ars_nouveau.glyph_desc.exchange: When used on blocks, exchanges the blocks in the players hotbar for the blocks hit as if they were mined with silk touch. Can be augmented with AOE, and Amplify is required for swapping blocks of higher hardness. When used on entities, the locations of the caster and the entity hit are swapped.
ars_nouveau.glyph_desc.explosion: Causes an explosion at the location. Amplify increases the damage and size by a small amount, while AOE will increase the size of the explosion by a large amount, but not damage.
ars_nouveau.glyph_desc.extend_time: Extends the time that spells last, including buffs, fangs, and summons
ars_nouveau.glyph_desc.extract: Applies a silk-touch effect to Break and causes Explosion to not destroy blocks that drop. Cannot be combined with Fortune.
ars_nouveau.glyph_desc.fangs: Summons Evoker Fangs in the direction where the spell was targeted. Using fangs on your self will spawn them in an area around you.
ars_nouveau.glyph_desc.fell: Harvests entire trees, mushrooms, cactus, and other vegetation. Can be amplified with Amplify to break materials of higher hardness. AOE will increase the number of blocks that may be broken at one time.
ars_nouveau.glyph_desc.firework: Creates a firework at the location or entity. Amplify will add Firework Stars, while Extend Time will add additional flight time. If a firework exists in the casters inventory, the created firework will mimic the held one. Spell Turrets with Touch will create fireworks as if they were dispensed.
ars_nouveau.glyph_desc.flare: When used on entities that are on fire, Flare causes a burst of damage and will spread fire and deal damage to other nearby entities. Does significantly more damage than Harm. Can be augmented with Extend Time, Amplify, and AOE.
ars_nouveau.glyph_desc.fortune: Increases the drop chance from mobs killed by Damage and blocks that are destroyed by Break. Cannot be combined with Extract
ars_nouveau.glyph_desc.freeze: Freezes water or lava in a small area or slows a target for a short time.
ars_nouveau.glyph_desc.glide: Grants the Glide effect, allowing the wearer to fly as if they were wearing an Elytra.
ars_nouveau.glyph_desc.gravity: Causes blocks and entities to fall. When augmented with Extend Time, players will have their flight disabled and will obtain the Gravity effect. While afflicted with Gravity, entities will rapidly fall and take double falling damage.
ars_nouveau.glyph_desc.grow: Causes plants to accelerate in growth as if they were bonemealed.
ars_nouveau.glyph_desc.gust: Knocks a target away a short distance from the caster
ars_nouveau.glyph_desc.harm: A spell you start with. Damages a target. May be increased by Amplify, or applies the Poison debuff when using Extend Time. Note, multiple Harms without a delay will not apply due to invincibility on hit.
ars_nouveau.glyph_desc.harvest: When used on grown crops, this spell will obtain the fully grown product without destroying the plant.
ars_nouveau.glyph_desc.haste: Provides a speed boost to the target.
ars_nouveau.glyph_desc.heal: Heals a small amount of health for the target. When used with Extend Time, the Regeneration buff is applied instead, up to level 5. When used on Undead, the spell will deal an equal amount of magic damage.
ars_nouveau.glyph_desc.hex: Applies the Hex effect up to level 5. Hex increases any damage taken by a small amount while the user is afflicted by poison, wither, or fire. Additionally, Hex cuts the rate of Mana Regeneration and healing in half.
ars_nouveau.glyph_desc.ignite: Sets blocks and mobs on fire for a short time
ars_nouveau.glyph_desc.intangible: Causes blocks to temporarily turn into air. Can be modified with Amplify for blocks of higher hardness, AOE, Duration Down, and Extend Time.
ars_nouveau.glyph_desc.interact: Interacts with blocks or entities as it were a player. Useful for reaching levers, chests, or animals.
ars_nouveau.glyph_desc.invisibility: Causes the target to turn invisible for a short time.
ars_nouveau.glyph_desc.launch: Boosts a target into the air. Can be used for large jumps or for scaling mountains!
ars_nouveau.glyph_desc.leap: Launches the target in the direction they are looking. Amplification will increase the distance moved.
ars_nouveau.glyph_desc.light: If cast on a block, a permanent light source is created. May be amplified up to Glowstone brightness, or Dampened for a lower light level. When cast on yourself, you will receive night vision. When cast on other entities, they will receive Night Vision and Glowing.
ars_nouveau.glyph_desc.lightning: Summons a lightning bolt at the location. Entities struck will be given the Shocked effect. Shocked causes all additional lightning damage to deal bonus damage, and increases the level of Shocked up to III. Lightning also deals bonus damage to entities that are wet or wearing RF powered items. Can be augmented with Amplify, Dampen, and Extend Time.
ars_nouveau.glyph_desc.orbit: Summons three orbiting projectiles around the caster that will cast a spell on any entities it may hit. Additional projectiles, their speed, radius, and duration may be augmented.
ars_nouveau.glyph_desc.phantom_block: Creates a temporary block that will disappear after a short time.
ars_nouveau.glyph_desc.pickup: Picks up nearby items in a medium radius where this spell is activated. The range may be expanded with AOE.
ars_nouveau.glyph_desc.pierce: When applied to the Projectile spell, projectiles may continue through their path an additional time after hitting a mob or block. Causes certain effects to also target the block behind them, like Break. Combines with AOE to provide depth.
ars_nouveau.glyph_desc.place_block: Places blocks from the casters inventory. If a player is casting this, this spell will place blocks from the hot bar first.
ars_nouveau.glyph_desc.projectile: A spell you start with. Summons a projectile that applies spell effects when this projectile hits a target or block.
ars_nouveau.glyph_desc.pull: Pulls the target closer to the caster
ars_nouveau.glyph_desc.redstone_signal: Creates a brief redstone signal on a block, like a button. The signal starts at strength 10, and may be increased with Amplify, or decreased with Dampen. The duration may be extended with Extend Time.
ars_nouveau.glyph_desc.rune: Places a rune on the ground that will cast the spell on targets that touch the rune. Unlike runes placed by Runic Chalk, these runes are temporary and cannot be recharged. When using Item Pickup, items are deposited into adjacent inventories.
ars_nouveau.glyph_desc.self: A spell you start with. Applies spells on the caster.
ars_nouveau.glyph_desc.shield: Applies the Shield buff. This buff will reduce a flat amount of damage taken from magical and physical sources. Does not reduce damage from environmental sources.
ars_nouveau.glyph_desc.smelt: Smelts blocks and items in the world. AOE will increase the number of items and radius of blocks that can be smelted at once, while Amplify will allow Smelt to work on blocks of higher hardness.
ars_nouveau.glyph_desc.snare: Stops entities from moving and jumping. Extend Time will increase the duration of this effect.
ars_nouveau.glyph_desc.split: Causes multiple projectiles to be cast at once. Each projectile applies a set of effects.
ars_nouveau.glyph_desc.strength: Applies the Strength buff up to level 3.
ars_nouveau.glyph_desc.summon_decoy: Summons a decoy of yourself. Upon summoning, the decoy will attract any nearby mobs to attack it. Does not apply summoning sickness.
ars_nouveau.glyph_desc.summon_steed: Summons a saddled horse that will vanish after a few minutes. AOE will increase the amount summoned, while Extend Time will increase the duration of the summon. Applies Summoning Sickness to the caster, and cannot be cast while afflicted by this Sickness.
ars_nouveau.glyph_desc.summon_vex: Summons three Vex allies that will attack nearby hostile enemies. These Vex will last a short time until they begin to take damage, but time may be extended with the Extend Time augment.
ars_nouveau.glyph_desc.summon_wolves: Summons two wolves that will fight with you. Extend Time will increase the amount of time on the summons. Applies Summoning Sickness to the caster, preventing other summoning magic.
ars_nouveau.glyph_desc.toss: Causes the caster to place an item from their inventory to a location. If this glyph is used on an inventory, the item will attempt to be inserted into it.
ars_nouveau.glyph_desc.touch: Applies spells at the block or entity that is targeted.
ars_nouveau.glyph_desc.underfoot: Targets the spell on the block beneath the player.
ars_nouveau.ritual_desc.binding: The Ritual of Binding converts nearby eligible entities into Bound Scripts, used for summoning a Familiar. For more information, see the section on Familiars.
ars_nouveau.ritual_desc.burrowing: Digs four adjacent holes to bedrock, dropping any blocks.
ars_nouveau.ritual_desc.challenge: Summons an illager raid when used inside a village. An Emerald may be used to increase the difficulty of the raid to the maximum amount, making Totems of the Undying accessible on easier difficulties. Augmenting has no effect on Hard difficulty.
ars_nouveau.ritual_desc.cloudshaping: This ritual can change the weather at a moments notice. By default, this ritual will set the weather to clear. Augmenting with Gunpowder will cause it to rain, while a Lapis Block will cause it to storm.
ars_nouveau.ritual_desc.disintegration: Destroys nearby monsters and converts them into Experience Gems worth twice as much experience. Monsters destroyed this way will not drop items. This ritual consumes source each time a monster is destroyed.
ars_nouveau.ritual_desc.fertility: Periodically causes nearby animals to breed if possible. This ritual requires source to operate, and will have no effect if there are twenty or more animals nearby.
ars_nouveau.ritual_desc.flight: Grants nearby players the Flight effect when they jump, allowing them to creatively fly for a short time. If the player is nearby, this ritual will refresh their flight buff. Each time this ritual grants or refreshes flight, it will expend source from nearby jars.
ars_nouveau.ritual_desc.overgrowth: Occasionally bone meals blocks in the area around it. This ritual requires source to operate. If augmented with a Bone Block, this ritual will instead force baby animals to grow faster.
ars_nouveau.ritual_desc.restoration: Heals nearby entities or harms undead over time. Additionally, Zombie Villagers will be instantly cured, and the resulting villager will offer discounts if a player was nearby. This ritual requires source to operate.
ars_nouveau.ritual_desc.scrying: Grants vision of a given block through any other block for a given time. White particles signify you are very close, green is semi-far, and blue particles are blocks very far from you.  To complete the ritual, throw any block of your choice before starting. You may also add a Glyph of Extend Time to increase the duration to 15 minutes.
ars_nouveau.ritual_desc.warping: Warps all nearby entities to the location on a warp scroll. Before starting the ritual, you must first augment the ritual with an inscribed Warp Scroll.
ars_nouveau.ritual_desc.wilden_summon: Without augments, this ritual will summon a random variety of Wilden monsters for a short duration. When augmented with a Wilden Spike, Wilden Horn, and a Wilden Wing, this ritual will summon the Wilden Chimera, a challenging and destructive monster. Note: If summoning the chimera, this ritual will destroy blocks around the brazier.
ars_nouveau.book.name: Worn Notebook
ars_nouveau.book.landing_text: Ars Nouveau provides spell crafting, magical devices, powerful trinkets, and magical entity automation. To help  development or report issues, join the community: https://discord.gg/y7TMXZu Thank you for playing.
ars_nouveau.spell_book.copied: Copied %d new glyphs to the book.
ars_nouveau.color_gui.title: Spell Color
ars_nouveau.spell_arrow.desc: Augments spells when used with an Enchanter's Bow.
ars_nouveau.spell_parchment.no_spell: Set your spell book to a spell.
ars_nouveau.warp_scroll.wrong_dim: Using this scroll from a different dimension would be a bad idea.
ars_nouveau.warp_scroll.inv_full: There is no room in your inventory.
ars_nouveau.warp_scroll.recorded: You record your location to your Warp Scroll.
ars_nouveau.warp_scroll.no_location: Use while sneaking to set a location.
ars_nouveau.whelp.invalid: A Bookwyrm cannot cast an invalid spell.
ars_nouveau.whelp.desc: Give this Bookwyrm a spell by giving it some inscribed Spell Parchment.
ars_nouveau.whelp.spell_item: This Bookwyrm will use %s in spells if this item is in a Summoning Crystal chest.
ars_nouveau.glyph_press.no_mana: There does not appear to be enough Source nearby.
ars_nouveau.summoning_crystal.adjacent: Set area to adjacent blocks only.
ars_nouveau.spell.validation.crafting.in: There are problems with this spell.
One or more glyphs in this spell are invalid.
ars_nouveau.spell.validation.exists._com: __ These messages appear when reporting on an existing spell that is invalid. __
ars_nouveau.spell.validation.exists.non_: The spell may not be empty.
ars_nouveau.spell.validation.exists.max_: The spell has an extra form glyph: %s
ars_nouveau.spell.validation.exists.star: The spell does not start with a form glyph.
ars_nouveau.spell.validation.exists.acti: %s was augmented by %s too many times.
ars_nouveau.spell.validation.exists.glyp: %s is too powerful for your current spell book.
ars_nouveau.spell.validation.adding._com: __ These messages appear when attempting to add a glyph that would make a spell invalid. __
ars_nouveau.spell.validation.adding.non_: The spell may not be empty.
ars_nouveau.spell.validation.adding.max_: The spell already has a form glyph.
ars_nouveau.spell.validation.adding.star: The spell must start with a form glyph.
ars_nouveau.spell.validation.adding.acti: %s is already augmented to the limit by %s.
ars_nouveau.spell.validation.adding.glyp: %s has appeared its maximum number of times.
%s is too powerful for your current spell book.
tooltip.potion_flask_extend_time: Increases the duration of potions by 50%.
tooltip.potion_flask_amplify: Increases the level of potions, but reduces their duration.
ars_nouveau.page4.wixie_charm: Wixies will autocraft potions using nearby Potion Jars and items. Potions that require Water will be supplied by the Wixie. Potions that require another potion as a base will be taken from nearby Potion Jars. A Wixie will output 3 doses of a Potion into a nearby Potion Jar when complete. To begin, place down an empty Potion Jar, right click the cauldron with an Awkward Potion, and supply Nether Wart from a nearby chest.
ars_nouveau.page5.wixie_charm: When using multiple Wixies, you may wish to lock a jar to a specific potion. Wixies will only output potion to jars that contain the same potion, or an unlocked empty potion. Each craft costs Source. See the section on the Potion Jar for more information.
ars_nouveau.page.potion_flask: A flask that stores 8 charges of a potion. To fill the flask, use the flask on a Potion Jar, or craft the flask in a Crafting Table with another potion. You may empty the flask by using the flask on a Potion Jar while sneaking.
ars_nouveau.page.potion_flask_extend_tim: An enchanted flask that extends the time of effects by 50%%
ars_nouveau.page.potion_flask_amplify: An enchanted flask that increases the power of effects by 1, but reduces their time in half.
ars_nouveau.tooltip.exp_gem: Grants experience on use. Sneak to consume the entire stack.
ars_nouveau.tooltip.mana_bloom: Grown from seeds crafted using the Enchanting Apparatus.
ars_nouveau.tooltip.dull: A dull trinket, cannot be worn. Used for crafting.
ars_nouveau.sword.invalid: Invalid spell. Swords accept Effects and Augments only, such as Freeze -> Extend Time.
ars_nouveau.page.enchanters_sword: Applies a Touch spell before damaging an entity. Additionally, all spells gain one additional Amplify augment on the last effect in the spell. Apply a spell at the Scribes Table that does NOT contain a form, such as Ignite -> Extend Time.
ars_nouveau.page.enchanters_shield: Upon blocking damage, the user will gain a short duration of Mana Regeneration and Spell Damage. Additionally, this shield will repair over time using the wearers mana.
ars_nouveau.tooltip.can_inscribe: Can be inscribed with a spell at the Scribes Table.
tooltip.ars_nouveau.caster_tome: Casts a spell at half the cost or the users entire mana bar, whichever is smaller.
tooltip.ars_nouveau.caster_level: Can cast tier %s glyphs or lower.
tooltip.ars_nouveau.drygmy_shard: Obtained by giving a Drygmy a Wilden Horn.
ars_nouveau.page.drygmy_charm: Drygmys are often found following and tending to animals around it. They can be found anywhere, though somewhat rarely. Drygmys can be given a home in the world, and will produce items from nearby monsters and animals as if they were slain, without harming them. A wild drygmy may be befriended by throwing a Wilden Horn near it!
ars_nouveau.page2.drygmy_charm: A Drygmy can also produce experience gems!
ars_nouveau.page3.drygmy_charm: To summon a Drygmy, use a Drymy Charm on a block of Mossy Cobblestone. After a short time, the cobblestone will transform into a Drygmy Henge and summon your Drgymy! To summon additional drygmys, use more charms on the henge. Casting dispel or killing the Drygmy will return your charm.
ars_nouveau.page4.drygmy_charm: A Drygmy considers its home to be 10 blocks in every direction from its home. The drygmy will use this area to produce items from any entities nearby. Your drgymy's efficiency is dependent on its happiness. This may be increased for each entity nearby, with a bonus for each unique type in its home.
ars_nouveau.page5.drygmy_charm: Each Drygmy working around a henge contributes progress. Once maximum progress has been reached, the henge will generate items and experience gems and deposit them into nearby inventories. Each time this occurs, the henge will require Source to recharge. The number of drops and experience gems is equal to the Drygmy happiness and experience value of the entities. To get started, place a chest and jar of Source next to the Henge.
tooltip.ars_nouveau.tablet: A tablet used for rituals. Consumed on use.
ars_nouveau.enchanting.bad_level: This item must have the previous level of enchantment.
ars_nouveau.enchanting.incompatible: This enchantment is incompatible with this item.
tooltip.ars_nouveau.wilden_tribute: Obtained by defeating the Wilden Chimera. See Ritual of Summon Wilden.
tooltip.ars_nouveau.summon_focus: Increases the duration and power of your summons.
ars_nouveau.page1.armor: Magical robes provide additional mana and bonus mana regen. To cast the largest and most powerful spells, you will need a mana pool bigger than a beginning spell caster. Each piece of armor will provide a bonus, and each tier provides a greater bonus than the previous. To begin crafting armor, you will need to obtain Mageblooms.
ars_nouveau.page1.books: Accessing higher tier spells will require a better spell book. While a novice spell book only has access to Tier 1 spells, the Apprentice and Archmage spell books will unlock tiers two and three. Upgrading your spell book will transfer all of the spells that you have learned into your new book. Books may be dyed by crafting them with a piece of dye.
ars_nouveau.page1.warding_stone: A block that can act as a lava source for monsters. Placed on the ground, monsters will avoid walking over the stone while players are free to pass.
ars_nouveau.page1.warp_scroll: A scroll that may be used a single time to teleport to a recorded location. However, teleporting across dimensions is not possible. Can be used to warp other entities if an inscribed scroll is held in the offhand and the holder casts Blink on an entity.
ars_nouveau.page1.glyph_press: Accessing new spells requires a special machine designed to convert items into glyphs. These glyphs can be used to unlock new spells in a spell book or may be used in special crafting recipes. Creating a glyph will require a special form of magical clay, a reagent for the spell, and nearby source provided by a source jar. To use the glyph press, first place your clay into the press.
ars_nouveau.page2.glyph_press: Then, use the reagent provided on the press. If there is enough source nearby, the press will begin crafting. Source can be provided by a nearby Source Jar. The glyph press may be automated using Hoppers. A hopper from any side will place Clay, while a hopper from the top can insert the reagent for the clay. If there is enough source nearby, the crafting will start automatically. If a chest is adjacent to the glyph press, glyphs will be deposited automatically.
ars_nouveau.page1.potion_jar: A jar that stores up to 100 potions. Potion can be removed by using an Empty Bottle or Potion Flask on the jar. Wixies will use these jars during Potion Autocrafting. The jar may be locked by using a Dominion Wand while sneaking. Locked Jars will only receive the potion it is locked to from Wixies. Can be used with a Comparator.
ars_nouveau.page1.potion_melder: Converts three doses of a potion from two adjacent Potion Jars, and outputs a single dose of mixed potion into a Potion Jar beneath it. The Potion Melder requires source per mix.
ars_nouveau.page1.ritual: A brazier that may be used as decoration or for performing rituals. To light the brazier for decoration, cast a Light spell on the brazier. The color of the brazier corresponds with the color of the spell. Applying a redstone signal will disable a running ritual. For information on performing rituals, see the dedicated section on rituals.
ars_nouveau.page1.scribes_table: It is possible to copy your spells to a new book, either as a backup or as a way to share with your friends. First, place a spell book on the scribes table. Then, while sneaking, use another spell book on the table. This will copy the spells from the book you are holding to the book on the table.
ars_nouveau.page2.scribes_table: You may also write a specific spell to Spell Parchment which is used in teaching magical servants how to cast spells. To do this, place a Spell Parchment on the table. Then, with your spell book in hand, change your spell book to your desired spell as if you were going to cast it. Then, use the book on the table while sneaking. Your parchment will now contain that spell recipe.
ars_nouveau.page1.warp_portal: Warp portals, like warp scrolls, provide a one-way teleport to any location, provided it is in the same dimension. To construct a Warp Portal, build a frame from Arcane Bricks or its variants in the shape of a nether portal and provide a full Source Jar nearby. Then, throw a warp scroll with a written location into the frame. Given there is enough source nearby, the portal will be created.
ars_nouveau.page2.warp_portal: A magical portal that can send players, mobs, spells, and items to any location in the same dimension.
ars_nouveau.page1.arcane_ore: Source Gem Ore is slightly more common than gold and provides Source Gems. Source Gems are used for crafting curios, unlocking new spells, and building devices. Source Gems may also be created renewably through the use of the Crystallizer.
ars_nouveau.page1.archwood: Archwood Trees have a small chance to spawn in any biome, and come in four types. Rarely, you may stumble upon an Archwood Forest, a biome full of magical creatures, naturally spawning lights, and Archwood trees. Can be used as decoration, rituals, or for crafting wands.
ars_nouveau.page1.decorative: Purely decorative blocks. To see the full list, place Arcane Stone in a Stonecutter.
ars_nouveau.page1.lava_lily: A decorative block that can be placed on any liquid or block. The texture of this block varies if it is placed on Lava, a Magma Block, or any other block.
ars_nouveau.page1.mana_berry: A Source Berry Bush can be found in Taiga and Archwood Forest biomes, and produces Source Berries. A Source Berry can be used to craft a Potion of Mana Regeneration or consumed as food. Carbuncles will automatically harvest fully grown Source Berry Bushes, making them useful for early automation of the Agronomic Sourcelink. Source Berry foods will also grant Mana Regeneration.
ars_nouveau.page1.sconce: A decorative light. To ignite, cast Light on the sconce. The color of the flame corresponds with your spell color.
ars_nouveau.page1.wilden: An ancient race that mastered shapeshifting magic, Wilden are hostile creatures that can be commonly found at night. While Wilden Defenders may only be found in cold biomes, Stalkers and Pack Hunters can be found in any biome.
ars_nouveau.page2.wilden: An aggressive and fast hunter that can summon allied wolves.
ars_nouveau.page3.wilden: Generally spawning in small groups, Stalkers have ground and aerial attacks.
ars_nouveau.page4.wilden: Found in cold biomes, a Defender is a slow moving heavy hitter with a ranged attack.
ars_nouveau.page5.wilden: Summoned with a Ritual of Wilden Tribute, the chimera is a powerful and destructive mid-level boss.
ars_nouveau.page6.wilden: The Chimera is a worthy fight for a caster with Tier 2 spells and equipment. The Chimera resists cold damage, and a variety of spells including buffs, dispel, and mobility are suggested.
ars_nouveau.page1.agronomic_sourcelink: The Agronomic Sourcelink generates source from nearby crop and tree growth. Bonus mana is generated for magical plants such as Mageblooms, Source Berry Bushes, and Archwood Saplings. Source will be output from the Sourcelink to nearby jars within 5 blocks. Note: Bonemealing crops will not grant Source.
ars_nouveau.page1.source_jar: Source Jars store source gathered from nearby Sourcelinks. Source is used in glyphs and rituals by powering devices like the Glyph Press and Enchanting Apparatus. Source may be moved using a bucket, or the jar can be picked up and moved. To use Source in a jar, simply place the jar near your desired device. Source Jars will provide a signal to Redstone Comparators based on their fill level.
ars_nouveau.page1.volcanic_sourcelink: The Volcanic Sourcelink generates Source by consuming burnable items. Archwood logs will generate bonus mana, with Blazing Archwood generating the most. As the Volcanic Sourcelink produces Source, it also produces $(item)heat$(), used for spawning Lava Lilies and converting stone into lava. The Volcanic Sourcelink automatically outputs to nearby jars, starting with the one closest to it.
ars_nouveau.page2.volcanic_sourcelink: Nearby Blazing Archwood items will be burned up in exchange for a chunk of mana and a moderate amount of $(item)heat$().
ars_nouveau.page3.volcanic_sourcelink: The Volcanic Sourcelink will occasionally convert Stone into Magma Blocks, and Magma Blocks into Lava, given that these blocks exist beneath it in its 3x3 area. This conversion is dependent on the amount of $(item)heat$() it has produced over time. The Volcanic Sourcelink will also spawn a Lava Lily adjacent to it given that there is nothing covering the lava. Lava Lilys may be harvested and used for decoration.
ars_nouveau.page4.volcanic_sourcelink: The color of a Lava Lily changes if it is placed above lava, magma, or other blocks.
ars_nouveau.page1.summon_focus: A special casting focus. Grants summons from spells additional duration, strength, speed, and deals damage to enemies that kill them. Additionally, casting spells that target you like Self and Orbit will cast a copy of the spell on your nearby summons.
ars_nouveau.page1.allow_scroll: Provides a list of items to automation related entities. To inscribe an item, place on the Scribes Table and use blocks and items on the table while sneaking. When given to a Carbuncle, the carbuncle will only pickup and take items on the scroll.
ars_nouveau.page1.deny_scroll: Provides a list of items to automation related entities. To inscribe an item, place on the Scribes Table and use blocks and items on the table while sneaking. When given to a Carbuncle, the carbuncle will pickup and take any item that is NOT on this scroll.
ars_nouveau.page1.mimic_scroll: Provides a list of items to automation related entities. When this scroll is attached to an inventory, entities will only insert items that already exist in the inventory. To attach the scroll, place an item frame on the inventory, and place a Mimic Scroll in it.
ars_nouveau.page1.dominion_wand: A tool for configuring Source Relays and automation entities. To set a transfer path, use the wand on the object that you would like to take source from, and then use it on the block you would like to send source to. For example: Source Jar to Source Relay, Source Relay to Source Relay, or Source Relay to Source Jar. To clear connections, sneak and use this wand on a relay.
ars_nouveau.page1.alchemical_sourcelink: Generates source by consuming potions from adjacent potion jars. The amount of source varies per potion and is dependent on the complexity of the potion. Bonus source is given for the length and level of the potion with multipliers for each effect a potion contains. Utilizing Wixies and Potion Melders is recommended for creating highly complex potions.
ars_nouveau.page1.vitalic_sourcelink: Generates a moderate amount of source from nearby mob death and animal breeding. Additionally, the Vitalic Sourcelink will generate passive mana from nearby baby animals and will accelerate their growth.
ars_nouveau.page1.mycelial_sourcelink: Generates a moderate amount of source from nearby food, generating more for more nourishing food. Source Berry food is worth far more than other mundane foods. Additionally, the Mycelial Sourcelink will convert Grass or Dirt in the 3x3 below it into Mycelium and will grow mushrooms around it given that the space is empty.
ars_nouveau.page.relay_deposit: Operates similar to the Source Relay, but will deposit to jars it is not linked to within 5 blocks. See the instructions on the Source Relay for use.
ars_nouveau.page.relay_warp: Operates similar to the Source Relay: Splitter but can teleport source an endless distance between other Warp relays. For distances beyond 30 blocks, there is a chance that some source will be lost during warp.
ars_nouveau.familiar.sickness: You must wait before summoning another familiar.
ars_nouveau.category.familiars: Familiars can provide passive buffs and assistance in combat. For more information, see the section on Summoning a Familiar.
ars_nouveau.page2.summoning_familiars: To begin summoning familiars, you will need to obtain a Bound Script of the entity you wish to befriend. These can be obtained by performing the Ritual of Binding near a relevant entity. See the full list of eligible entities in the Familiars section. Once you have obtained a Bound Script, use it to learn the familiar.
ars_nouveau.page3.summoning_familiars: Once you have obtained a bound script, you may access your list of familiars from your Spellbook crafting menu in the Familiars section. Selecting a Familiar will summon it in the world and give you Familiar Sickness, preventing you from summoning another one for a short time. To obtain your first familiar, perform the Ritual of Binding near a Carbuncle. Familiars are bound to the player and cannot be transferred between books.
ars_nouveau.page4.summoning_familiars: Typically only one familiar may be out at a time, and summoning another familiar will remove others bound to you. You may dismiss your own familiar by casting Dispel on it. In exchange for empowering the owner, familiars will reserve a portion of max mana from their owner for as long as they persist in the world.
ars_nouveau.familiar.script: Used for obtaining familiars. Obtained from the Ritual of Binding.
ars_nouveau.mirror.invalid: Invalid spell. Mirrors accept Effects and Augments only.
ars_nouveau.page.enchanters_mirror: Applies a self spell to the user. Spells cast with this mirror are discounted and gain additional bonus duration to all glyphs. Apply a spell at the Scribe's table that DOES NOT contain a form such as Strength -> Heal.
ars_nouveau.page.spell_turret: Turrets can be used to cast spells when given a redstone signal, functioning like a dispenser. Turrets will accept spells that use Touch and Projectile. Spells may be set using an inscribed piece of Spell Parchment. In order to cast spells, turrets will draw source from nearby Source Jars. Turrets may use Item Pickup and Place Block as long as an inventory is placed adjacent to this block.
ars_nouveau.page.spell_turret2: Enchanted Spell Turrets cast spells at half the source cost compared to basic spell turrets.
ars_nouveau.page.spell_turret3: Timer Spell Turrets will automatically fire on a timer. Defaulted to 1 second, the time may be increased by right-clicking the block. Punching will decrease the time. Sneaking will allow you to configure it in 10 second intervals. To prevent further changes, lock and unlock the turret using the dominion wand. Setting the turret to 0 seconds or providing a redstone signal will disable it. Casts Projectile, Touch, and Redstone for free.
ars_nouveau.page.spell_turret4: Turrets can provide compact and efficient automation. Examples include: configurable redstone clocks, one block tree or crop farms, rapid smelting with fortune, or mob farms with looting.
